caption:
- Dropped off, picked up, dropped off, picked up.
- Got groceries.
- Client B work.
- Talked to a startup CEO. I thought we were going to talk about a potential contract, but he announced that in the last couple of days that his company had pivoted from a Peloton-ish fitness company to an internal business tools company.
- Helped the guy with some homework. There was a problem that I really didn't know how to do. Specifically, how to do it with standard second-grader knowledge. We rolled with the guy's direction on this because the way I thought of involved square roots. But even to do it his way, we had to create a ruler on another piece of paper, which seemed too complex. I'm interested in seeing what the actual designer-intended solution is.
- Client A work. It's not the worst in the world, but this contract may have not been the best decision on my part in terms of pay for effort.
htmlFragment:
• 1/11/2022, 10:38:49 PM

    - Got groceries.
    - Client B work.
    - Talked to a startup CEO. I thought we were going to talk about a potential contract, but he announced that in the last couple of days that his company had pivoted from a Peloton-ish fitness company to an internal business tools company.
    - Helped the guy with some homework. There was a problem that I really didn't know how to do. Specifically, how to do it with standard second-grader knowledge. We rolled with the guy's direction on this because the way I thought of involved square roots. But even to do it his way, we had to create a ruler on another piece of paper, which seemed too complex. I'm interested in seeing what the actual designer-intended solution is.
    - Client A work. It's not the worst in the world, but this contract may have not been the best decision on my part in terms of pay for effort.

caption:
From How to Move to Canada:
When Canadians talk about what it means to be Canadian, it’s often to this charter that they return as an expression of fundamental principles and beliefs. They also deﬁne themselves as a peacekeeping nation and as a nation with respect for law. “Peace, order, and good government” is how they put it—the “POGS.”
Remember Pogs? They’re back — in ideological acronym form.
htmlFragment:
• 1/13/2022, 7:48:31 PM
    From How to Move to Canada:
    When Canadians talk about what it means to be Canadian, it’s often to this charter that they return as an expression of fundamental principles and beliefs. They also deﬁne themselves as a peacekeeping nation and as a nation with respect for law. “Peace, order, and good government” is how they put it—the “POGS.”
    Remember Pogs? They’re back — in ideological acronym form.

caption:
- Dropped off, picked up, dropped off, picked up.
- Called about some health insurance stuff.
- Updated [basic-browser-request](https://github.com/jimkang/basic-browser-request) to address a dependency security vulnerability.
- Client B work.
- Client A work. I might be close to the end of this?
- More toilet plunging. I'm determined to keep it performing at top-level.
- Made dinner.
- Got the guy to practice some writing. I tried saying, hey, want to do some fun writing and earn a bunch of pom poms for the jar? But he said nah, so I had to make the fun mandatory. (I hate doing that because it erodes trust as well as being glaring proof of the failure of my activity design, but he sometimes literally writes one word per minute. He knows all the stuff he needs to know to do things in school, but this keeps him from keeping up.) Once he started it wasn't too bad, though.

I really, really hope I can do something besides client work next week. If every week were like this, it would defeat the point of part-time contract work.
htmlFragment:
• 1/13/2022, 10:00:55 PM

    - Updated [basic-browser-request](https://github.com/jimkang/basic-browser-request) to address a dependency security vulnerability.

    - Client A work. I might be close to the end of this?
    - More toilet plunging. I'm determined to keep it performing at top-level.
    - Made dinner.
    - Got the guy to practice some writing. I tried saying, hey, want to do some fun writing and earn a bunch of pom poms for the jar? But he said nah, so I had to make the fun mandatory. (I hate doing that because it erodes trust as well as being glaring proof of the failure of my activity design, but he sometimes literally writes one word per minute. He knows all the stuff he needs to know to do things in school, but this keeps him from keeping up.) Once he started it wasn't too bad, though.

    I really, really hope I can do something besides client work next week. If every week were like this, it would defeat the point of part-time contract work.

caption:
Hey, I beat Slay the Spire with fighter guy again. (Statistically, I’m better with Robot or Thief.) I had a real swingy deck with not quite enough blocking, but one healing card that would usually heal a lot because it was strength-based, and this deck pumped up strength steadily throughout each battle.

I also had five action points by default and Ice Cream and also Unceasing Top, which lead to being able to play quite a lot of cards per turn.
altText: Hey, I beat Slay the Spire with fighter guy again. (Statistically, I’m better with Robot or Thief.)
htmlFragment:
• 1/15/2022, 12:23:04 AM
    Hey, I beat Slay the Spire with fighter guy again. (Statistically, I’m better with Robot or Thief.) I had a real swingy deck with not quite enough blocking, but one healing card that would usually heal a lot because it was strength-based, and this deck pumped up strength steadily throughout each battle.

    I also had five action points by default and Ice Cream and also Unceasing Top, which lead to being able to play quite a lot of cards per turn.

caption: Oh, yeah, I finished Confessions of a Crap Artist a week or so ago. It was hilarious, and I was a little stunned that there was no science fiction in it. Maybe PKD has other non-sci-fi work? I thought he was 100% sci-fi. But it's just five or so characters interacting in the '60s, each sharing their points of view in turn. It actually has a general shape that would later be shared by Coen Bros. movies.
htmlFragment:
• 1/15/2022, 3:53:24 PM
    Oh, yeah, I finished Confessions of a Crap Artist a week or so ago. It was hilarious, and I was a little stunned that there was no science fiction in it. Maybe PKD has other non-sci-fi work? I thought he was 100% sci-fi. But it's just five or so characters interacting in the '60s, each sharing their points of view in turn. It actually has a general shape that would later be shared by Coen Bros. movies.

caption:
Princess Louise, daughter of Queen Victoria and wife of the then governor.
of Canada, did not think much of Pile 0’ Bones as a name for town, much less a territorial capital. In 1883, when the railroad reached this former Indian campsite on the prairie that was about to go on to greater dim, the princess intervened. She named the new capital of the Northwest Territories in honor of her mother.
Yet another strike against monarchs.
htmlFragment:
• 1/16/2022, 7:47:50 PM
